page.title: 01Musbury,South East Devon
page.content: This block is situated in the south eastern part of Devon, close to the border with Dorset. It is sparsely populated with few amenities. Most of the area is devoted to Dairy Farming with a significant amount of forestry. The only public transport is a bus service which goes through the eastern part. Local people are almost entirely dependant on private means of transport. There are storng historical connections with incidents during the civil war. Much earlier there was great activity during the Roman occupation and before that the early Britons had a fortified settlement. A very beautiful, unspoiled area, it is attractive to tourist who enjoy the pleasures of the unspoilt countryside.
